creditline: Gift of Jack and Linda Hoeschler, Kristen and Terry O'Brien and Jack and William O'Brien, and Frederick and Julia Hoeschler
inscription: written center verso in black ink: FOTO / MANUEL CARRILLO / Bolivar 21 / MEXICO. D F
text: Manuel Carrillo came to photography later in life, at the age of forty-nine. From that moment onwards he set out to photograph throughout the country of Mexico, focusing mainly on its people. Children to adults, in groups and as individuals, appear posed or going about their days. Photographs such as this one are a hallmark of Carrillo's documentary style, one filled with respect for his sitters and their lives.
title: Dando elote al burrito, Santa Rosa, Guanajuato
